q: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
h:
“Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.” —
Soren Kierkegaard

q: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
h:
“Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Happiness is only real when shared.
h:
“Happiness is only real when shared.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.
h:
“You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.” —
Simon Sinek

q: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
h:
“The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.” —
Alfred Adler

q: The temptation to give up is strongest just before victory.
h:
“The temptation to give up is strongest just before victory.” —
Zen Proverb

q: To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts.
h:
“To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart.
h:
“Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: You can't make someone feel good about themselves until you feel good about yourself.
h:
“You can't make someone feel good about themselves until you feel good about yourself.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.
h:
“Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.” —
William Faulkner

q: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
h:
“You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club. ” —
Jack London

q: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.
h:
“Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
h:
“Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: It's easy to wish for health when you're sick.  When you're doing well, you need just as much vigilance.
h:
“It's easy to wish for health when you're sick. When you're doing well, you need just as much vigilance.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.
h:
“Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: The quality of your life is determined by the quality of your thoughts.
h:
“The quality of your life is determined by the quality of your thoughts.” —
Unknown

q: It's OK to have your eggs in one basket as long as you control what happens to that basket.
h:
“It's OK to have your eggs in one basket as long as you control what happens to that basket.” —
Elon Musk

q: Cherish forever what makes you unique, cuz you're really a yawn if it goes.
h:
“Cherish forever what makes you unique, cuz you're really a yawn if it goes.” —
Bette Midler

q: Reading should be a pleasure, not a chore.
h:
“Reading should be a pleasure, not a chore.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Art is to console those who are broken by life.
h:
“Art is to console those who are broken by life.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The sun is new each day.
h:
“The sun is new each day.” —
Heraclitus

q: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
h:
“Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.” —
John D. Rockefeller

q: Admire as much as you can. Most people do not admire enough.
h:
“Admire as much as you can. Most people do not admire enough.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.
h:
“I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Unless someone truly has the power to say no, they never truly have the power to say yes.
h:
“Unless someone truly has the power to say no, they never truly have the power to say yes.” —
Dan Millman

q: Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.
h:
“Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.” —
Colin Powell

q: Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up.
h:
“Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
h:
“I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.” —
Beverly Sills

q: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
h:
“Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.” —
John Wooden

q: Do not be awe struck by other people and try to copy them. Nobody can be you as efficiently as you can.
h:
“Do not be awe struck by other people and try to copy them. Nobody can be you as efficiently as you can.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.
h:
“Life is about choice. You can choose to be a victim or anything else you like to be.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Happiness is a quality of the soul...not a function of one's material circumstances.
h:
“Happiness is a quality of the soul...not a function of one's material circumstances.” —
Aristotle

q: Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.
h:
“Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
h:
“It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere. ” —
Voltaire

q: Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.
h:
“Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: If you can change your mind, you can change your life.
h:
“If you can change your mind, you can change your life.” —
William James

q: Think and wonder, wonder and think.
h:
“Think and wonder, wonder and think.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.
h:
“There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Youth ages, immaturity is outgrown, ignorance can be educated, and drunkenness sobered, but stupid lasts forever.
h:
“Youth ages, immaturity is outgrown, ignorance can be educated, and drunkenness sobered, but stupid lasts forever.” —
Aristophanes

q: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
h:
“You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Don't stumble over something that's behind you.
h:
“Don't stumble over something that's behind you.” —
Steve Harvey

q: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
h:
“When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
h:
“Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.” —
Mark Twain

q: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.
h:
“I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.” —
Carl Jung

q: Life is like underwear, should be changed twice a day.
h:
“Life is like underwear, should be changed twice a day. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
h:
“The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.
h:
“Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.
h:
“Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: A needle is not sharp at both ends.
h:
“A needle is not sharp at both ends. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.
h:
“You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.” —
Richard Bach

q: It is not enough to win a war; it is more important to organize the peace.
h:
“It is not enough to win a war; it is more important to organize the peace.” —
Aristotle

q: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
h:
“Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.” —
Sun Tzu

q: When you view failure as feedback, you get more done. When you view failure as a finality, you get nothing done.
h:
“When you view failure as feedback, you get more done. When you view failure as a finality, you get nothing done.” —
Jack Butcher

q: The decisions of our past are the architects of our present.
h:
“The decisions of our past are the architects of our present.” —
Dan Brown

q: Only by attracting the best people will you accomplish great deeds.
h:
“Only by attracting the best people will you accomplish great deeds.” —
Colin Powell

q: I believe that potential is unlimited - success depends on daring to act on dreams.
h:
“I believe that potential is unlimited - success depends on daring to act on dreams. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.
h:
“Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: A hopeless man is a very desperate and dangerous man, almost a dead man.
h:
“A hopeless man is a very desperate and dangerous man, almost a dead man.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: All wealth is the product of labor.
h:
“All wealth is the product of labor.” —
John Locke

q: Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.
h:
“Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.” —
Tony Robbins

q: There is no excuse for not trying.
h:
“There is no excuse for not trying.” —
Barack Obama

q: The world doesn't owe you anything. It was here first.
h:
“The world doesn't owe you anything. It was here first.” —
Mark Twain

q: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
h:
“He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Art, like morality, consists of drawing the line somewhere.
h:
“Art, like morality, consists of drawing the line somewhere.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too.
h:
“When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: We are all here for some special reason.
h:
“We are all here for some special reason.” —
Robin Sharma

q: To do great work one must be very idle as well as very industrious.
h:
“To do great work one must be very idle as well as very industrious.” —
Samuel Butler

q: What is planted in each person's soul will sprout.
h:
“What is planted in each person's soul will sprout. ” —
Rumi

q: Life may be full of pain but that's not an excuse to give up.
h:
“Life may be full of pain but that's not an excuse to give up.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: When your intuition is strong, follow it.
h:
“When your intuition is strong, follow it.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
h:
“To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow. ” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.
h:
“Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: The friend is the man who knows all about you, and still likes you.
h:
“The friend is the man who knows all about you, and still likes you.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: It's very important to like the people you work with, otherwise life and your job is gonna be quite miserable.
h:
“It's very important to like the people you work with, otherwise life and your job is gonna be quite miserable.” —
Elon Musk

q: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
h:
“You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.” —
Brian Tracy

q: When you are talented you do it whatever it is until your fingers bleed or your eyes are ready to fall out of your head.
h:
“When you are talented you do it whatever it is until your fingers bleed or your eyes are ready to fall out of your head.” —
Stephen King

q: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
h:
“Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.
h:
“To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.
h:
“A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.” —
Criss Jami

q: Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.
h:
“Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.” —
Robin Sharma

q: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?
h:
“If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?” —
John Wooden

q: Being wrong brings the opportunity for growth.
h:
“Being wrong brings the opportunity for growth.” —
Mark Manson

q: It's wise to tell the truth. It's even wiser to tell it kindly.
h:
“It's wise to tell the truth. It's even wiser to tell it kindly.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand - relax.
h:
“Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand - relax.” —
Osho

q: Success comes from knowing that you did your best to become the best that you are capable of becoming.
h:
“Success comes from knowing that you did your best to become the best that you are capable of becoming.” —
John Wooden

q: The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts.  Let it go. It is not serving you.
h:
“The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts. Let it go. It is not serving you.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Life happens in the river, not the shore.
h:
“Life happens in the river, not the shore.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The scariest monsters are the ones that lurk within our souls.
h:
“The scariest monsters are the ones that lurk within our souls.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
h:
“Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom. ” —
Bodhidharma

q: Your happiness is what truly matters most. Do what you have to do in order to be happy.
h:
“Your happiness is what truly matters most. Do what you have to do in order to be happy.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.
h:
“Inner peace is when you realize that, in the end, nothing matters.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Freedom itself demands discomfort.
h:
“Freedom itself demands discomfort.” —
Mark Manson

q: He who violates another's honor loses his own.
h:
“He who violates another's honor loses his own.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: When you are able to employ your will always for constructive purposes, you become the controller of your destiny.
h:
“When you are able to employ your will always for constructive purposes, you become the controller of your destiny.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions.
h:
“Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Success is built sequentially. It's one thing at a time.
h:
“Success is built sequentially. It's one thing at a time.” —
Gary Keller

q: Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.
h:
“Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
h:
“The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.” —
Richard Bach

q: The mind is the limit.
h:
“The mind is the limit.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.
h:
“The quality of your commitments will determine the course of your life.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
h:
“Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.
h:
“To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.” —
Criss Jami

q: The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.
h:
“The truth is simple. If it was complicated, everyone would understand it.” —
Walt Whitman

q: The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.
h:
“The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Optimism, when applied to your life, develops strength and peace within you.
h:
“Optimism, when applied to your life, develops strength and peace within you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: The guest will judge better of a feast than the cook.
h:
“The guest will judge better of a feast than the cook.” —
Aristotle

q: You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.
h:
“You can do nothing to change the past, and the future will never come exactly as you plan or hope for.” —
Dan Millman

q: Freedom from desire leads to inner peace.
h:
“Freedom from desire leads to inner peace.” —
Lao Tzu

q: When you lose your desire for things that do not matter, you will be free.
h:
“When you lose your desire for things that do not matter, you will be free.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
h:
“Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.” —
Aristotle

q: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
h:
“The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.” —
Colin R. Davis

q: The primary point of this existence is to live, and all living things move and grow.
h:
“The primary point of this existence is to live, and all living things move and grow.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
h:
“Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Even the finest sword plunged into salt water will eventually rust.
h:
“Even the finest sword plunged into salt water will eventually rust.” —
Sun Tzu

q: It is the power of thought that gives man power over nature.
h:
“It is the power of thought that gives man power over nature.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: It is in the heart that makes a man rich. He is rich according to what he is, not according to what he has.
h:
“It is in the heart that makes a man rich. He is rich according to what he is, not according to what he has.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: There is no path to Love. Love is the path.
h:
“There is no path to Love. Love is the path.” —
Dan Millman

q: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
h:
“Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.” —
Aristotle

q: You find peace not by rearranging the circumstances of your life, but by realizing who you are at the deepest level.
h:
“You find peace not by rearranging the circumstances of your life, but by realizing who you are at the deepest level.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
h:
“Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: Listening well is as powerful as talking well, and is also as essential to true conversation.
h:
“Listening well is as powerful as talking well, and is also as essential to true conversation.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: From morning till night, we should never rely on a single thing.
h:
“From morning till night, we should never rely on a single thing.” —
Huang Po

q: We all give up great expectations along the way.
h:
“We all give up great expectations along the way.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Everybody's life is either rewarding or an example.
h:
“Everybody's life is either rewarding or an example.” —
Tony Robbins

q: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
h:
“A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise. ” —
Buddha

q: Thinking is a habit, and like any other habit, it can be changed; it just takes effort and repetition.
h:
“Thinking is a habit, and like any other habit, it can be changed; it just takes effort and repetition.” —
John Eliot

q: Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.
h:
“Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.
h:
“Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: It's what you do in the present that will redeem the past and thereby change the future.
h:
“It's what you do in the present that will redeem the past and thereby change the future.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not the merits of who receives them.
h:
“Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not the merits of who receives them.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: The seasons do not push one another; neither do clouds race the wind across the sky. All things happen in their own good time.
h:
“The seasons do not push one another; neither do clouds race the wind across the sky. All things happen in their own good time.” —
Dan Millman

q: It is only depth of character that determines the profundity with which we face life.
h:
“It is only depth of character that determines the profundity with which we face life.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Thinking is the hardest work there is. That is why so few people engage in it.
h:
“Thinking is the hardest work there is. That is why so few people engage in it.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Nothing gives one person so much advantage over another as to remain always cool and unruffled under all circumstances.
h:
“Nothing gives one person so much advantage over another as to remain always cool and unruffled under all circumstances.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
h:
“A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Whatever happened, happened for the good. Whatever is happening, is happening for the good. Whatever will happen, will also happen for the good.
h:
“Whatever happened, happened for the good. Whatever is happening, is happening for the good. Whatever will happen, will also happen for the good.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
h:
“We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.
h:
“How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Many a man has failed because he had his wishbone where his backbone should have been.
h:
“Many a man has failed because he had his wishbone where his backbone should have been.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.
h:
“Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.” —
James Cameron

q: No man is more cheated than the selfish man.
h:
“No man is more cheated than the selfish man.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.
h:
“When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.” —
Robert Greene

q: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
h:
“In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.” —
Robert Frost

q: Greatness lies not in being strong, but in the right use of strength.
h:
“Greatness lies not in being strong, but in the right use of strength.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.
h:
“Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Trying to predict the future is like trying to drive down a country road at night with no lights while looking out the back window.
h:
“Trying to predict the future is like trying to drive down a country road at night with no lights while looking out the back window.” —
Peter Drucker

q: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
h:
“Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: The wise warrior avoids the battle.
h:
“The wise warrior avoids the battle.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
h:
“Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.” —
Alan Watts
